references.paper_title: Gromov-Wasserstein Distances and the Metric Approach to Object Matching
references.reason: This paper introduces the Gromov-Wasserstein distance, which is the core focus of the current paper.
This book provides a comprehensive overview of optimal transport, which forms the foundational context for the Gromov-Wasserstein distance.

references.paper_title: Optimal transport for structured data with application on graphs
references.reason: This paper presents a Conditional Gradient method for solving the Gromov-Wasserstein problem, which serves as a key comparison point for the proposed SDP relaxation.

references.paper_title: Sinkhorn distances: Lightspeed computation of optimal transport
references.reason: This paper introduces the Sinkhorn algorithm for efficient computation of optimal transport, providing a crucial efficiency comparison for the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Semidefinite Programming Relaxations for the Quadratic Assignment Problem
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it details semidefinite programming relaxations for quadratic assignment problems, which are closely related to the Gromov-Wasserstein problem.
